comments: Limit_{n->inf} a(n)/2^((n-1)(n-2)/2) = Product{k=1..inf} 1/(1-1/2^k) = 3.462746619455... (cf. A065446). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Jan 24 2005It appears that the Hankel transform is 2^A002412(n). [From _Paul Barry_, Aug 01 2008]Hankel transform of aerated sequence is A125791. [From _Paul Barry_, Dec 15 2010]
formula: a(n) = sum_{i=1}^{n-1} q^{(i-1)} a(i) a(n-i).G.f. satisfies: A(x) = 2*x/(2-A(2*x)) = x/(1-x/(1-2*x/(1-2^2*x/(1-2^3*x/(1-...))))) (continued fraction). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Jan 24 2005G.f. satisfies: A(x) = x*Sum_{n>=0} Product_{k=0..n-1} A(2^k*x). [From _Paul D. Hanna_, May 17 2010]a(n) = the upper left term in M^(n-1), M = the infinite square production matrix:1, 2, 0, 0, 0,...1, 2, 4, 0, 0,...1, 2, 4, 8, 0,...1, 2, 4, 8, 16,......Also, a(n+1) = sum of top row terms of M^(n-1). Example: top row of M^3 = (17, 34, 56, 64, 0, 0, 0...); where a(4) = 17 and a(5) = 171 = (17 + 34 + 56 + 64). - _Gary W. Adamson_, Jul 14 2011G.f.: T(0), where T(k) = 1 - x*(2^k)/(x*(2^k) - 1/T(k+1) ); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Oct 17 2013
prog: (PARI) a(n)=if(n==1,1,sum(i=1,n-1,2^(i-1)*a(i)*a(n-i))) (Hanna)(PARI) {a(n)=local(A); if(n<1,0, A=vector(n); for(k=1,n, A[k]=if(k<2,1, sum(i=1,k-1,2^i*A[i]*A[k-i])/2)); A[n])} /* _Michael Somos_, Jan 30 2005 */(PARI) {a(n)=local(A); if(n<1,0,A=O(x); for(k=1,n, A=x/(1-subst(A,x,2*x)/2)); polcoeff(A,n))} /* _Michael Somos_, Jan 30 2005 */
